quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Alec Baldwin
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, drama. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How does Tom Cruises character, David Aames, get disfigured in the 2001 movie Vanilla Sky?

options.text: He was burned with acid as a child.
His ex-girlfriend cuts his face out of jealousy.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In a car crash

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning actress starred opposite Alec Baldwin in the 1996 drama movie Ghosts of Mississippi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whoopi Goldberg

questions.question: Tom Cruise received his first Academy Award nomination for his outstanding performance in this 1989 movie.

options.text: Born on the Fourth of July

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Born on the Fourth of July

questions.question: What is the name of the character portrayed by Tom Cruise in the Mission: Impossible movie series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ethan Hunt

questions.question: Tom Cruises performance in the 2005 movie War of the Worlds brought him a nomination for this award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden Raspberry Award

questions.question: In what 2006 spy movie did Alec Baldwin star as FBI Agent Sam Murach?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Good Shepherd

questions.question: Who is the director of the 2004 biographical drama movie The Aviator that featured Alec Baldwin among others?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Scorsese

questions.question: What animal character did Alec Baldwin voice in the 2008 animated movie Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lion

questions.question: In what movie did Tom Cruise portray Dr. Bill Harford?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyes Wide Shut

questions.question: What animal did Alec Baldwin voice in the 2001 comedy movie Cats  Dogs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dog

questions.question: Alec Baldwin portrayed a man who dies and turns into a ghost in this 1988 movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beetlejuice

questions.question: What is the occupation of Jerry Maguire, portrayed  by Tom Cruise in the 1996 movie Jerry Maguire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sports agent

questions.question: What is the offensive title of the book written by Frank T.J. Mackey, played by Tom Cruise, in the 1999 movie Magnolia?

options.text: How To Get Laid For Less Money
She Is Only After Your Wallet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seduce And Destroy

questions.question: In what 2006 Martin Scorsese movie did Alec Baldwin portray Captain George Ellerby, commander of the Special Investigations Unit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Departed

questions.question: Alec Baldwin starred opposite this Hollywood actress in the 1992 romantic fantasy movie Prelude to a Kiss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meg Ryan

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Duke Ellington and Gary Cooper
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, drama. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When was Gary Cooper born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1901

questions.question: Duke Ellington was born on April 29, 1899 in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington, D.C.

questions.question: In which 1992 drama movie did Tom Cruise star opposite Jack Nicholson and Demi Moore?

options.text: Born on the Fourth of July

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Few Good Men

questions.question: In 1927, Duke Ellington and his band, The Washingtonians were offered a permanent job at which famous Harlem club?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cotton Club

questions.question: From what disease did Gary Cooper die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cancer

questions.question: What is the nickname of Tom Cruises character in the 1986 movie Top Gun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maverick

questions.question: Which of these is not a famous piece by Duke Ellington?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One OClock Jump

questions.question: According to Duke Ellingtons autobiography, his childhood dream was what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To be a baseball player

questions.question: Jazz musician Duke Ellington attended which high school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Armstrong Manual Training School

questions.question: Which of these prominent musicians did not play in Duke Ellingtons orchestra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freddie Green

questions.question: This composer and pianist wrote Take the A Train, which became the signature tune of Duke Ellington.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Strayhorn

questions.question: This book, published in 1973, is Duke Ellingtons autobiography.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Music Is My Mistress

questions.question: In 1917, Duke Ellington formed his first music group, named what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dukes Serenaders

questions.question: What is the title of the 2003 movie in which Tom Cruise starred as war veteran Captain Nathan Algren?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Last Samurai

questions.question: Which statement, concerning the awards and honors received by Duke Ellington, is true?

options.text: He was awarded the Legion of Honor by France in 1973
He was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom
A 22 cent commemorative stamp with his name and picture was issued in 1986

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these are true

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Gary Cooper and Movies
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, athlete. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which two movies earned Gary Cooper Academy Awards?

options.text: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town and Today We Live
A Farewell to Arms and For Whom the Bells Toll

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sergeant York and High Noon

questions.question: Gary Cooper was a man of many hobbies. Which of these was one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: taxidermy

questions.question: Gary Cooper was present when an escalator was put into a movie theater for the first time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Find the incorrect statement concerning Gary Cooper.

options.text: Tony Soprano often referred to Gary Cooper as the strong silent  type.
A poster of Cooper was used to help win free elections in Poland.
John Wayne learned to ride a horse from Gary Cooper.
Gary Coopers daughter once spat at the actress Patricia Neal.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Wayne learned to ride a horse from Gary Cooper.

questions.question: Gary Cooper is famous for his portrayal of this athlete.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Gehrig

questions.question: Gary Cooper appeared at the House Un-American Activities Committee in the 1950s. Which best describes his testimony?

options.text: He named ten writers who were Communists.
He said he feared Communism but did not mention any names.
He said there was no danger from Communism in Hollywood.
He named ten people in Hollywood who were Communists.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He said he feared Communism but did not mention any names.

questions.question: Gary Cooper starred in A Farewell to Arms and For Whom the Bell Tolls. What do these movies have  in common?

options.text: They are based on novels by Ernest  Hemingway.
They both were directed by Fritz Lang.
They are based on novels by John Steinbeck.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are based on novels by Ernest  Hemingway.

questions.question: In which Hall of Fame was Gary Cooper inducted?

options.text: The Screen Actors Guild  Hall of Fame
The National Hall of Great Americans
National Cowboy and Western Heritage Museum

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Cowboy and Western Heritage Museum

questions.question: Before becoming a star, Gary Cooper was a guide in this US Park.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yosemite

questions.question: By some quirk of  fate, Gary Cooper was distantly related to this actress.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooke Shields

questions.question: Although John Wayne and Gary Cooper were good friends, John Wayne hated this Gary Cooper role.

options.text: Ashley Wilkes in Gone With the Wind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Will Kane in High Noon

questions.question: How many times was Gary Cooper married?

options.text: Three times: to Marlene Dietrich, Patricia Neal, and Gloria Swanson
Once to a woman not in show  business
Four times: to Clara Bow, Evelyn Brent, Carole Lombard, and Ingrid Bergman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Once to a woman not in show  business

questions.question: Gary Cooper is referenced in an Irving Berlin song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How did Frank James Cooper become Gary Cooper?

options.text: He was given that name by Ron Howard.
His football coach at UCLA gave him the name.
Spencer Tracy said, He looks like a Gary.
His agent was born in Gary, Indiana.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His agent was born in Gary, Indiana.

questions.question: 1939 has often been described as a banner year for movies. Which of these 1939 movies starred Gary Cooper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beau Geste
